A0T0wNb8yZ1-55QRUYFTYQ.text: I was so very excited to try some good eats from this Japanese-Filipino style restaurant. I went on a Sunday when they offer their Filipino Brunch! I ordered Beef Estofado and Sotanghon Guisado. The flavors were good but a bit on the bland side compared to the authentic Filipino dishes I've eaten both abroad in the Philippines and stateside in Washington DC. The beef tasted vey similar to a traditional American crockpot-made beef stew. The noodle dish (Sotanghon Guisad) tastes like plain noodles with a hint of garlic and sesame oil. One of my closest friends is a Filipino chef and resides in Manila Philippines so I've been afforded the opportunity to taste many authentic Filipino dishes (street food and restaurant food) with flavors that are so rich and well crafted they leave your mouth waters days later just thinking about it! So to be completely honest I was left underwhelmed and would give those two dishes a 3.5 on a 5point scale.  I also took advantage of the buy one get one half-off sushi deal. I ordered the Khaleesi Roll & Spicy Scallop Roll. Hands down one of the best sushi experiences in the university area that I've had. The sushi tasted fantastic and the speciality rolls are unique, bursting with intense flavor, and fresh!  The sushi is definitely a 4.0 on my 5point scale. All in all this place is mostly know for hibachi which I have yet to try. I am planning a second visit just for hibachi. So far I'm a fan of the sushi but could leave the Filipino dishes on the table.

pgLm7J7cg7PVIGtEJoDI3g.text: Funny tip that perhaps nobody really needs:  After parking, do not walk into the first door you see underneath the store's sign.   Unless of course, you want Cold Stone ice cream.  Yea I was distracted by my excitement to try this place and missed the signs on the sidewalk that I should have followed to the other side of the building for the real Bachi entrance.  I actually called the restaurant asking where they were located and they explained this to me (hey it was dark, we all make mistakes J).    Vegan options- Absolutely awesome! They make it easy by even separating these.   The cauliflower wings - give me a platter please.  So much flavor (perhaps because they marinate the cauliflower) and the perfect crunch with vegan ranch.  Hold on while I wipe my drool.  Ok I'm back.  I had one of the creative sushi rolls - King Liam - which had plantains, vegan cream cheese and cucumbers.  So much more flavor and texture than some of the places where vegetarians and vegans are limited to avocado rolls.  As if this wasn't enough food, the fatboy in me wanted to try the vegetarian meal (ask them to make it vegan and they happily oblige).  This came with fried rice, garlic noodles, mixed veg and a salad.  The best part of the food coma was that when you come out of it, there is zero regret.  I wish this place were closer to me but will definitely get up here any free weekend I have.  Great service, great food and a gem for people with dietary restrictions.

HuX5bVEYYLlqncZXazDDZA.text: I just moved to the area and i've been on the search for my goto Japanese restaurant. Bachi appeared in several places that I searched, they are pretty new, so I decided to give them a try. When I walked in I was greeted immediately and given a menu. We ordered the Steak & Shrimp as well as the Steak & Scallops togo. The wait wasn't too long. Maybe about 10-15 minutes and my order was ready. A waitress also offered us water as we waited. First thing that turned me off from them is that they do not offer the Japanese Mustard sauce. This isn't a big deal though as I find it hard to find, but with this I knew they wouldn't be my goto. They nickel and dime you with the sauces! One little 2oz container of White Sauce and then 50 cent for any additional sauces. That was pretty annoying. The food was good though. It had a good hit of flavor. My only complaints are that they are definitely skimpy on the veggies, the zucchini was cut way too big, and my scallops were overcooked and small. Though I was able to finish my plate and be satisfied, i'm still on the search for a fav!!

A family own quaint, but vibrantly decorated restaurant, Bachi focuses its attention on traditional, and incredible, Filipino cuisine.  They also carry an extensive and extravagant sushi menu.  One of the managing partners, Basilio, was kind enough to walk us through the menu extensively, answer all our questions of wonderment.  Truly delicious and truly hospitable Bachi has perfected a much needed spin on habachi.

NUeeqbUlpcB0bmLWxKwFGQ.text: Want a place that keeps you well fed? This is the one for you! After eating here I felt like I was never going to get back up. I heard about the opening day of this place and was highly upset on the special I missed. Either way I came in on an empty stomach and knew I was going to give this a full try of multiple different things on the menu. I ordered the baked mussels, hibachi scallop dinner, the pua roll( vegetarian option), and the uhh it's 10:30 roll. First thing that grabbed my attention was all the creative sushi roll names (I am sucker for clever sayings). The next thing that grabbed my attention was the server at the register. She was extremely upbeat and very welcoming. When it comes to the food, I can say this place doesn't hold back. I am pescatarian and of course love good quality seafood. The mussels were a decent size and full of flavor as were the scallops on my hibachi dinner. My rolls weren't labeled which was exciting to me because I wanted to see if I could taste the difference between the vegetarian roll and salmon roll. Other than the True texture of the fish, the veggie roll tasted just as good. I really like this place and hopes it lasts, the area it's in is kind of congested with hibachi places but this one is one of quality I will say.

rBuz-PzVJi0Ul5KmMO506w.text: Honestly, Bachi was just okay.  I like TinTin's hibachi and prices much better. The place has a fast food feel to it, but charges sit down dinner prices.  It was very clean and bright, but awfully loud!  The extra tall ceilings made everything echo.  As for the food, my edamame was good, but it was served with my lunch instead of an appetizer.  I did like that they served a salad, noodles and rice with my meal.  Sometimes it is really hard for me to chose between rice and noodles so I was pumped to have both.  My hibachi chicken was a tad dry which made me kick myself for not ordering just veggies instead.  I don't think I will be back despite being able to walk there from my job.  I would opt to drive to Toyama or TinTin for sure.  They are just better.

O7eaAiVyK98ViMCTe56qKA.text: Bachi is your very average sushi spot. It's not too great, but not bad either. The best attributes they have is that they are affordable and offer vegan sushi which I'm not sure if other places have options like that. I ordered the empanadas, spicy scallop roll, and caliente roll. All items were decent, but once again, not great. The sushi rolls were very small from what I'm used to, but had pretty good flavor. I would not order the empanadas again. They were listed as pork empanadas, so it was very shocking when I bit into it and it had an overwhelming sweet taste. Definitely not what you expect when ordering a savory dish. The dough was sweet and it had raisins inside which is not a smart move. Compared to the sushi rolls at Tin Tin right down the street from here, Bachi is lacking. I probably won't come back, but it wasn't a bad one-timer.

gQSOhOvc5OcCMbDtZMDicA.text: An interesting concept.   I discovered Bachi with a girlfriend when my usual sushi spot wasn't opened. They are tucked right past Cold Stone Creamery.   They have a mixture of Filipino food, hibachi, and sushi at decent prices. I can't speak for authenticity but the sushi was delicious. They were fresh and preparation was quick. The rice to filling ratio was a great potion, so I was not complaining. They also had B1G1 1/2 off (Sundays) so the price wasn't too bad.   Overall, my meal and my friends' were delicious. The service was great and we felt extremely welcomed.

rmo7SVUSirH1gvFwlRfQ0g.text: I recently visited this location and was pleasantly surprised by how open it feels, compared to previous restaurants that were in the same space. I wanted to secure dinner before I went to the gym (don't judge) so I ordered to-go hibachi (chicken & shrimp). The price came to about $16 and it came with plenty of vegetables and noodles. It took about 7 minutes for my order to be made and handed to me... not bad considering all the food that came on the plate. Once I got it home, it literally looked like I'd just left a hibachi restaurant. The taste was AMAZING! So why did they lose a star? The to-go box that my food came in wasn't the best container to hold hot food with hibachi juice. The container became soft and I had hibachi juice on my counter, so I had to transfer it all to plate until I was able to enjoy after the gym.   Because they have other Filipino options and sushi, I will definitely be going back. This time, I will more than likely eat in. Nonetheless, I'm excited for this gem to join the Mallard Creek/Prosperity area.

QoRyuzLdcQA2_XGd5TXJUA.text: Great menu! Has vegan options as well as an extensive sushi menu! Food came out fast and was really good. Staff is very friendly!

74fxnfG3wtQ1H3lvLc8mPQ.text: I was excited to eat here for the first time this week, but left disappointed. I called ahead of time to see if they had gluten free options (which they do) and was happy to hear their all of the hibachi items are gluten free. I ordered and specifically said gluten free and it didn't seem like a problem. They brought us out salads that looked good but I wasn't sure about the dressing being gluten free so I asked and she confidently said it was gluten free. I'm about half way through when another person came up to me and told me that it was in fact NOT gluten free. I have an allergy so I immediately stop eating it and tell them..all they did was offer me a salad with a different dressing...the food was good but I will not be returning. I'm already sick from eating the gluten and extremely disappointed in how the entire situation was handled.

HIUFkw9bnNasraGLr5j20g.text: I've been to this place twice already and would totally go back more frequently if it was by my house. Such quality food and great portions for the price.   For starters, the first time I had the calamari, which was very well seasoned and came with a sweet dipping sauce. Second visit, I had the lumpia. And the pork was so flavorful and the rolls were so crispy. Def would get both again. My friends ordered several orders of the cauliflower wings and loved them; although I didn't try them.  For the entree, I had a hibachi combo plate of NY strip & shrimp. They give you fried rice, garlic noodles and veggies all for like $14. Unbelievable deal. AVWKQvXxPltMwhqGTVDygw.text: Eat it.  This place has a good model with the little plates.  It's easy to want to try a little bit of everything.  My partner and I went on a weekend night, close to close so it wasn't super busy.  We were deaddd after a 14 hour drive to Charlotte from the Northeast, but we needed some food.  We celebrated the end of the long trip with a couple beers and shared cauliflower wings, a sushi roll (I forgot the name), and a chicken hibachi plate.  The cauliflower wings were VERY good.  They were perfectly cooked, a little on the firmer side, with a good crust.  The vegan dip was excellent - very thick like an aioli and nicely spiced.  I could have eaten a whole cauliflower prepared like that.  The sushi roll had spicy tuna, cream cheese, broiled fish, and crunchies.  I was pleased that the spicy tuna was actually spicy by itself as opposed to a ton of a spicy mayo.  Pretty good with the charbroiled flavors.  The chicken combo plate was where things were just kind of ok.  The chicken, garlic noodles, and fried rice were kind of bland which was really disappointing for hibachi.  There was some "shrimp sauce" but I never really like drenching food in sauces - the food should be standalone.  The sauteed veggies were actually pretty good on the plate hah!  Service was good and 2 out of 3 dishes were enjoyable so I'd come back to try some of their other sushi and other small plates.

-N1FqMLf9mzngMYa0O3E9A.text: I heard great thing about Bachi and have wanted to find some authentic Filipino food in the Charlotte area. Since I was in the area I planned to have lunch here.   We got to the restaurant right before the lunch rush. I was a little taken a back by the lack of clean tables when we got there. Since the restaurant had just opened and the staff was chatting and playing on their phones when we got there I didn't expect for there to salt and debris all over the tables. No one ever wiped the tables off either.   We ordered the Chicken  and Shrimp hibachi style dinner and the Lola's Lumpia Shanghai appetizer. I knew that Lumpia was a Filipino dish but felt like the Chicken and Shrimp dish was more Japanese style dish.  The two were a lot of food for my mom and myself to share. We forced ourselves to finish the dinner plate and brought the Lumpia home to eat later. Yes it does seem like we should have eaten the fried dish first and brought home the other items to reheat later but the Lumpia came out after the other dish and was fresh out the grease and unable to consume until it cooled off. I would have to say they were fine to snack on at room temperature.   The Chicken and Shrimp Hibachi comes with both rice and noodles and hibachi veggies. There was also a side of shrimp sauce for the plate. The items were cooked well and not burned. The Lumpia really didn't have much flavor for me. Nothing stood out to me.   I like the concept of Bachi and I think they try but overall I wasn't impressed. I would never drive back to the Mallard Creek area to go here.   Bachi  2700 W Mallard Creek Church Rd, Ste 200, Charlotte, NC 28262 April 26, 2019 11:15am

ofwxGnnVVqQb1J8tfPRBmw.text: After two of my Yelp friends recommended this place, I had to check it out for myself. I went on a Friday evening within an hour of closing. It wasn't busy at all. I ordered a chicken, and a shrimp hibachi meal. I had them give me extra noodles to replace the veggies for the chicken since it was for my son.  The chicken was so juicy and fresh. JCW-9sefnG6sxDFuRQH9XQ.text: Slam dunk awesome hibachi and sushi. Pack it up boys, this review is over!  ... OK maybe I have a bit more to say, but the main takeaway from this review should be to put this place on your go-to list. I had a friend tell me about Bachi last night and the thought of crispy pork belly was too much to resist. Lunch plans for Sunday were set in stone. When we arrived, I wasn't sure what to expect as far as service style. Pleased to say that it's full service wait staff that seats you and takes your order. They have inside, outside, and sushi bar seating. Decor is minimalist and modern, very clean design. They have a handful of TV's around that of course on Sunday afternoon was showing NFL, I like it!  You know what the best part about my wife joining me for lunch? Splitting plates! We ended up getting an entree, a small plate, and two sushi rolls. First thing to arrive to the table was the Crispy Pork Belly dish. The pork belly had an amazing crust and cut thick. Just the right amount of fat-to-meat ratio. The dipping sauce was either ponzu or something similar. Bright and full of strong citrus flavor. Perfect start, at $9 its a steal.  For the entree we ordered the Hibachi NY Strip and Salmon Combo. Both proteins were delicious, great medium-rare on the strip and a moist petite cut of salmon. Veggies are almost universally too tender when cooked at a hibachi grill, but these veggies were treated very well and stood out on their own very nicely. The fried rice was absolutely perfect, and made me realize that this restaurant was like all the parts of my favorite Asian cuisine wrapped into one l experience.  For our rolls we chose a simple Salmon Maki-style roll and also a salmon skin roll. The simple roll was great, not to say that's easy. Maki rolls require high quality fish to stand out and this one really does! I've never had a salmon skin roll and quickly found that the texture is the key. They fry the salmon skin and it l compliments the veggies in the roll very well, while still giving the roll a good salmon flavor.  I can't wait to explore the Filipino dishes next time. This place hit all the high marks for me and it's great to see the new kid in this older shopping center thriving. A genuinely wonderful find!

UZKDWBKjfis94xJQy6d3SQ.text: When I heard about a new restaurant serving Filipino dishes, I had to check it out! The hubs and I decided to dine here on a Saturday evening. The place was pretty busy, but not packed. We were greeted upon entering and seated right away.  The space is a decent size, not too big. It's clean, bright, and open. Plenty of indoor seating and a few umbrella tables outside. In addition to a few Filipino dishes, Bachi also serves Hibachi style entrees, sushi, and other Japanese-inspired dishes. They also offer vegan options.  We tried the following: Caterpillar Roll $9.00 Miso Soup $2 Pork BBQ $8 Scallop Meal $11 Halo Halo $7 Ube Coconut Shake $5  The food is pretty authentic! The pork bbq, halo halo, and ube coconut shake tasted just like how I remembered them in the Philippines. Delicious! The sushi, soup, and scallop meal were also pretty good. Prices are very reasonable for the portions. Definitely worth a try!

tj32xe6MpRQJUQ5OjtXLmw.text: Listen I'm going to be over critical for sure. But i know what Filipino food should taste like. And if i could give 3.5 stars I would but I can't - so 3 it is.   I came here strictly for the Filipino food. It was actually the halo halo that I came here for.   We ordered the following items:   Kids meal - chicken with noodles. It's a super small amount of chicken just cut up into several small pieces. It's probably about 2-3oz worth of chicken. The noodles are just spaghetti noodles that are seasoned with spices and soy sauce. Not bad actually. The chicken breast a little dry and the veggies were a good assortment.   Crispy Cauliflower Wing - the first bite I was like what the ? But it actually grew on me and I enjoyed it. It has a crispy, slightly chewy batter that is sweet and tangy. The inside is soft and juicy.   Lola's Lumpia Shanghai - I love that it comes with 8 pieces. Not stingy at all. But they are petite. Most lumpia is thin so this is expected. It wasn't bad at all. I mean I'm particular to mine and my mom's but for eating out. I was pleasantly surprised.   Crispy Pork Belly - this was hands down the best thing we ordered. It was cooked perfectly and delicious. But... I asked for fish sauce and vinegar. They did have vinegar, no fish sauce. I told my man - the sever would probably look at me crazy if I asked for some Tomas Mang (all purpose sauce) (my other Filipinos will know what I'm talking about).  While this isn't a "Filipino" restaurant- I think if you're going to serve Filipino food why not have the accompaniments that normally go along with a dish. And any Pinoy will you tell they eat their pork belly with either Tomas mang or Paris (fish sauce) & vinegar.   Pork BBQ skewers - I would strongly suggest telling everyone to pass on this. And it's not because of the piece of hair embedded in one of our sticks. But it's just not authentic Filipino bbq and it was tough. And the glaze on it was just okay.   Halo Halo - it's pronounced hallow-hallow NOT Hey-low Hey-low. My server tried to correct me and pronounce it that way. I just smiled. They serve theirs in a Sunday Glass and it has most the components you would find in a traditional halo halo. Shaved ice, beans, jelly, flan, ube ice cream & more. It's not your typical American dessert so it's not super sweet but for me - it's something I grew up on and is near and dear to my heart. And listen to have the option to even get halo halo in Charlotte is extremely exciting to me. So I'll definitely be back just for this.   Overall, I would definitely return. The other food looks amazing and honestly what we had for the most part was pretty okay.   I'm just excited to see Filipino food in the Charlotte scene.

dm5ui7u1BGjrlizSltLkOA.text: I drove past one day and decided to stop and try it. The hibachi chicken is pretty good. It's hit or miss when you get it to go, but it's always been good when dining in. Maybe it just depends on the cook for the day. The vegan roll is really good as well. The portion size is good for the most part, they are just a little skimpy on the meat. The prices are great. RMPDYhCXYS8kgmM6wzmfcg.text: Coming from San Diego, it's hard to find good Asian food here.  Although you would never find a Japanese/Filipino combination together in the same restaurant in CA, Bachi is really good.  I only found Bachi because I searched for "lumpia" on Yelp.  In San Diego everyone eats lumpia and there are plenty of Filipino places to find it.  Shanghai Lumpia is our favorite.  It's usually made with pork or beef and seasoning.  It's rolled tight like a cigar and made with a thin wrapper.  Bachi's lumpia didn't disappoint at all.  In fact, my husband (the lumpia connoisseur) thought these were better than the SD ones.  Whoa.. that's something.  He also had a couple of sushi rolls which he also enjoyed.  I had the Teriyaki Chicken Plate.  For only $8 it was served "hibachi" style with veggies, a scoop of fried rice, and garlic noodles.  The chicken was  breast and it was good quality.  I didn't encounter any pieces of fat or gristle in my whole dish.  That's something.  The garlic noodles were good too.    Service was good and friendly even though the place was pretty busy.  They are located on the street side of the shopping center behind Cold Stone.  And if you don't like this place, Bachi on you. Haha I'm Japanese and Bachi loosely translated means "bad karma".

p_RPowZ2jjQ1rKNLYsMIyQ.text: This was my second time. Food is delicious and reasonably priced.  The service staff is very friendly and attentive. The Pork Adobo on the Sunday Filipino menu was amazing and the sushi was both beautiful and  extremely tasty.  The only negative is that they have terrible timing for getting food out.  Dishes come out when ready rather than all at the same time.  If you can overlook that, it's definitely worth going.

DozgwWVj4ey36QOU2hsTog.text: Whenever I try a new sushi place, I always get the spicy salmon roll so I can compare apples to apples in evaluating the quality of the sushi. Bachi doesn't even have a spicy salmon roll on the menu. They ended up substituting salmon in their spicy tuna roll. Aside from being ~$3 more than the average price of a spicy salmon roll in the area, it wasn't that great. The sushi's consistency was kind of soggy, the salmon was warm, and there was no spicyness to it.   As far as the hibachi, I don't know why they even asked for how I wanted the steak cooked because it came very well done and tough even though I asked for medium. I ate the steak without any of the rest of stuff and I swear they didn't season it at all.  I wouldn't be so critical of them if it wasn't for the price. They are trying to be a premium restaurant by charging above market prices for both sushi and hibachi. I do not think that Bachi is as good as, much less any better than, a regular old hibachi restaurant down the street; and their charging you a premium.

ctNaV-CdlKr6hf0ghzXX4A.text: The best in town. The food is amazing and the atmosphere is friendly. Professional staff, and fair prices. Overall an outstanding dining experience.

x1lG6PsqLnWlPBFHDjiacA.text: I really hate that I had to give this restaurant a one star. Bachi was recommended to me by my Yelp Elite friends so I was expecting a great experience. Unfortunately, it was the complete opposite. I am eating a vegan diet at the moment and I was very pleased to see they had a vegan section on the menu. I ordered the fried cauliflower, a side salad, a side of veggies, and the King Liam sushi roll which was fried plantain, carrots, cucumber, vegan cream cheese, topped with a spicy vegan mayo. Those were the exact ingredients listed on the menu. When I got the sushi roll, I ate one piece of the sushi and immediately knew something was wrong. My throat started to itch and my tongue started to swell. I called the waitress over and told her I was having an allergic reaction and I needed to see the menu again. I wanted to ensure that I didn't over look any ingredients that were listed. Upon the review of the menu, I asked her to ask management what ingredients were in the vegan cream cheese and mayo. Come to find out the vegan mayo is based with tree nuts. I immediately panicked because I have a nut allergy. I am not deathly allergic, but I do have tongue swelling, throat itching, and an upset stomach whenever I come in contact with any kind of tree nut. I told the cook that it needs to state on the menu that this menu item contains tree nuts because there are a lot of people that have a tree nut allergy. I took and Allegra because that's all I had at the moment and the itching and swelling stop within 30 min. I finished the rest of my food items. When the check came I noticed that the sushi roll was still listed on my check. I asked the waitress why was it still on my check and I sent it back immediately after the first piece AND I experienced an allergic reaction. The waitress said that she would have to talk with the manager to see if they would take it off. The manager came out and spoke to me from behind the counter. I felt that was extremely rude. The least he could have done was come over to where we were seated. He then proceeded to say that I should have told them I have a nut allergy before ordering. I have never in my life been to a place that doesn't list nuts, or "may contain tree nuts" on menu items that indeed have nuts in them. Then he went and pulled the container of the vegan mayo and showed the ingredients. I'm still trying to figure out his reasoning for showing me a package that was in your kitchen that as a consumer I would of had no idea contained nuts. I flat out told him I wasn't paying $9 for a roll that I had one piece of and sent back because of their negligence. He then stated he thought I ate the whole roll. So clearly there's a lack of communication between you and your staff. I work for public health and I will definitely be contacting my colleagues in environmental health to address this issue. I have pictures of the menu and even took a to go menu to show that tree nuts aren't listed on their menu. Had I had a more severe reaction and had to go to the hospital this would of easily been a lawsuit. Despite the fact that I had this reaction, the way the situation was handled was subpar and way below standards. My friend enjoyed her food and thought it tasted good. However, the whole experience horrible.

mAa2JZVsZ84pyYCrqgdWmQ.text: I never write reviews that are bad so that's why I couldn't give it one star. The service was fantastic, I had a lovey waitress that took care of me and made sure I was perfect the whole time. This is where I had to rate so low, I ordered some raw fish and I'm currently a sushi chef myself, the fish was a little warm and I knew I should've sent it back but went ahead and ate all the lovely nigiri I had ordered. Within 5 hours I was sick and vomiting, I didn't eat anything else but this and knew from the jump what it was. I hate putting any low review up but I was just dealt a bad card that's all, it's all in the business. Sadly I was just the small outlier. Thank you Bachi for a great experience I'm sorry that it ended this way

vJ_9TY99cXsiudb8nshIDQ.text: Good food great service went there 3/31/14 nice business. The Japanese food is good and the Philippine food is also good.

IeYdYqtfJNGqRFLBBAAfYg.text: I tried the peluche roll from the vegan menu and it was filling, the spicy mayo over powers the other flavors tho, reason for my 4 star rating.. Avocado roll was good too. Service was attentive and fast.

S4H4L9cFnu6Ugz7kZi3V7g.text: Everything was delicious. We shared the pork gyoza which was some of the best I ever had. The ribs were super tender and flavorful. Even my toddlers couldn't get enough of them. They had a special of bbq pork skewers that had amazing flavor and again the meat was very tender. We tried several sushi rolls including the scallop mix, yellow tail scallion roll and bachi roll. They were all fresh and so tasty. The wait staff was friendly and very attentive. Looking forward to dining there again soon!

h8isHb8OhJCsI2JYsxGtRA.text: Awesome food I had hibachi shrimp everything taste fresh and full of flavor! Really great price for the amount of food. I didn't even finish half of it and I still have a good amount for left overs! The shrimp sauce was the icing on the cake it was so good. The staff was so helpful and nice. I will be back new favorite place.

keDJoAu8Bvh_x6WS0e8gHA.text: Food was okay .. The apps were decent . I really liked the pork belly . wasn't a fan of the sushi but the hibachi was pretty good out of everything . Will I recommend it ? Sure if you want SOME GOOD hibachi ....  MY EXPERIENCE WAS MEDIOCRE. TIPS: when you walk in PLEASE SEAT YOURSELF... AS WHEN YOU LEAVE THEY'll be running to the table to clean it .

sLaAHryKfdiLzbLcxFxTug.text: The hibachi is AMAZING! Omg! Great portion and great taste! Please give them a try! It comes with a salad which is super unusual. Haha I'm getting ready to place an order with them now. Awesome service as well!

ldIF9AwArdJxKseFIy_D4A.text: Great fried cauliflower! I also had a veggie roll, but there were so many choices. I'd definitely go here again.

ug1Mko0Pp7AHFILDYOXfww.text: Just tried Bachi for the first time. Went here because it sounded interesting and they offer Vegan dishes. Had the tempura vegetables, crispy cauliflower wings and vegan fried rice to go. The Tempura Vegetables was the best item of the three. It was crisp and light. Not oily. The dipping sauce was disgustingly sweet and I just discarded it. Cauliflower wings were just a tad too big in size, which created a soggy affect in the end. They lacked any flavor. However, the dipping sauce was nice. It really needed some spice to bring up a notch. I wonder if the wings would be better had I  experienced it right away? Nonetheless they were tasteless and soggy when I had them. The fried rice was just ok.  Overall my food lacked flavor. I do not see myself going back. It's a shame. Really was hoping to love this food since they consciously offer a vegan menu.  The staff was kind and attentive. Atmosphere is very casual and laid back. Meal was prepared quickly.

OXMWNzDYPeMUWYCW3LE7wg.text: First time eating here on April 24th. This place is fantastic. It's clean, brightly lit, and with an open window to the kitchen. Perfect for lunch. Got the chicken/shrimp combination hibachi, and everything was delicious. Comes with small salad with ginger dressing, good portions of shrimp and chicken, helpings of both rice and garlic noodles, and mixed grilled vegetables (carrots, shrooms, broccoli, onions, zucchini). Perfectly seasoned, and not overly done with salt/garlic. Tastes just as good as more expensive, sit-down Japanese steakhouses. Two suggestions that would improve the experience from my particular point of view: (1) the portions are enormous. I'd probably be happier paying $2-$3 less for about 20% less food, and leave feeling more satisfied and less stuffed. (2) This place feels like a fast casual. But if you want to eat there, you are instructed to sit and be waited on (rather than just order, pay at the register, and take a number). So it's confusing as to whether you are expected to tip. Regardless of those two nit-picks...this one gets 5 stars, and I'll definitely be back.

OFrDN9RyKE79eL4ajsRxRQ.text: Bachi is the best in town!! The only suggestion I would make is another location on the south side! The food was delicious and so flavorful; I love hibachi and everything was freshly made; the veggies and the seafood. Also, the entire staff was so warm and welcoming which added an extra touch to our visit. I ordered the shrimp hibachi which was perfectly made and the wait was reasonable. I can't wait to go back the next time in University!

cX9eO6XumOUP9WnzYxmu1A.text: Ordered take out from here and got 2 sushi rolls and some hibachi steak and shrimp. The sushi was sort of soggy and not very flavorful. We asked for our steak to be medium and it was well done. It was pretty expensive for not the best quality. We still ate because we were hungry but overall was pretty disappointed with the food. Hopefully they get better since they just opened.

wlagBUsU9yg33j6Nu7hjOQ.text: Have been to this place twice, once for hibachi and once for sushi. Both were pretty legit...the sushi was way better than expected. I work up the street and live in the area so this will definitely be a new go too. I personally think the Hibachi has more flavor than Toyama down the street. I think this is a much better option than Teriyaki Madness that was in this location previously.

TpEywie61xdvJGZUzysYhg.text: Best habachi and sushi in Charlotte. Always a good meal and cheaper than most. Very Friendly. Clean and comfortable environment.

UCnZdYwsdAWxrFaYP87rdw.text: Went on Monday due to a friends suggestion. Service and food was outstanding. I will come back again!

PS39sOz5AMJgPUVZLgRGaA.text: Went on opening day, 11/5/18.  My wife and I have been trying to find a Filipino restaurant in Charlotte for awhile.  Even though Bachi only has small plate servings of Filipino food it is great! The lumpia Shanghai and crispy pata are great; they even have Halo-halo!  We shared a Ube and coconut milkshake for dessert.. it was amazing!  Definitely going back soon.   If I had to find a small fault, if any, I just wish there was more seating.  Once it fills up, ya gotta wait, but it is worth it!

hKajxS0-CzChP4LZD5sxrg.text: This place is so good & affordable. Bachi gives you a great portion of food & the service was very fast. Also the decorations & atmosphere in the restaurant is super cute! I would definitely recommend this place.

ppuoSyf3MyqdS_SkTkhwTg.text: I visited Bachi on a Saturday night around 6pm and was able to immediately be seated. This was my first time trying it. I got the chicken meal which comes with a salad, fried rice, garlic noodles, hibachi chicken, and veggies. The portions are amazing for what you're paying. My entire meal (I got water to drink) was like $8.58 and I took a fair amount of leftovers home with me. I would definitely recommend if you're looking for quick hibachi. Much better and higher quality than Toyama which used to be my go-to in the university area. The fried rice felt like it was missing something but was still good enough to eat. That's really the only critique I could give it.

EXU1KUmXGmG_9JfT1mQnxw.text: Food was good, very flavorful.  And then they started putting up chairs on tables with several tables still occupied. Then came the SMELL of horrific bleach and cleaning with mopping the floor, again right next to people eating!! Complained, and the waitress and owner could clearly not give a rats ass.  STAY AWAY from this place!

Nx1LaLnapBB_YU8OJ9Zbag.text: We went on a Wednesday at lunch and the sushi was buy one get one half off. It was really great and fresh. We also got a hibachi chicken plate, which was also great. The chicken was perfect, it was crispy and had the right amount of seasoning. It also came with rice and noodles, which is nice because you usually have to choose one or the other. It was really clean and the staff was super friendly. Will definitely be back and recommend it to others!

swMRXS2i7nahtii6hHu5zw.text: 1st time here.. got the hibachi steak and shrimp to go with 2 sushi rolls.. everything was fresh and delicious. We will definitely be back. Only comment I would make is that the prices seem high for the university area but then again prices are rising everywhere in CLT. Well done chefs.

mDiIbamtFDPGlk8yFpNSag.text: This place was packed and I can see why!  Our server was great, she answer all the questions we had got out our order in all the chaos.  The vegetable gyoza were my favorite item of the day, the vegetable tempura, empanadas, and science sushi roll were wonderful too.  I cannot recommend enough for vegetarian and vegetarian/meat eating groups.

XhgN_mH81QDh27FLSqfcWg.text: Visited last night after yelp recommended it. I have to say I was quite impressed. They were busy and booming. I got the 4 oz steak. Everything was cooked perfectly! I will def go back. I also tried a dessert.  Plantain wrapped like spring roll with ice cream and drizzled with Carmel sauce..I felt that the plantain was not cooked long enough. They were still quite hard. I also don't think they were ripe enough.  I suggest either par cook or let them ripen a little longer before flash frying them in the wrapper.  They did not cook long enough and was afraid that I might get sick. Other than that I'll def return. Hope you stay around for a long time! We need this in the area!

96xHAwCzvKQbqH94mpF0yQ.text: This was hands down one of the best places I have been to. I got the vegetarian meal combo and sushi rolls on the side. 5BJ559dXr8uRtUcYkpXhpA.text: Excellent service (Nicole was our server), affordable and serving size is perfect. Came here with my bro and both had a great experience. Will be coming here again.
